pr_title: Add first version of Spring Cache annotations

timeline.message: Add first version of Spring Cache annotations
Add first version of Spring Cache annotations

timeline.bodyText: SPRING_CACHE should come before SPRING_CLOUD_CONFIG_CLIENT if alphabetical order matters :)
timeline.author: gwenneg

replies.bodyText: It does, so I'll fix it
replies.author: geoand

timeline.bodyText: This message is not consistent with the test.
timeline.author: gwenneg
gwenneg
gwenneg

timeline.bodyText: Out of curiosity, will key be supported in the future?
timeline.author: gwenneg

replies.bodyText: Yes, I plan to add support for it. It shouldn't be too tough, but it will require more control over the interceptors than we currently have. We'll need something akin to what Spring Security uses.
replies.author: geoand

timeline.bodyText:
Is it OK to silently ignore at build time a @Cacheable annotation because of the absence of cache name?
Same question for the other cases below.
timeline.author: gwenneg

replies.bodyText: Good idea, I'll add a warning
replies.author: geoand

timeline.bodyText:
The code would be easier to read if this test was like the other ones :)
Edit: See this comment first.
timeline.author: gwenneg
gwenneg
gwenneg

timeline.bodyText:
You had an empty string check before, it is gone on purpose?
I expected return cacheName == null || cacheName.isEmpty() ? Optional.empty() : Optional.of(cacheName); here.
timeline.author: gwenneg

replies.bodyText: Yeah I guess you are right. I should update it to be on the safe side
replies.author: geoand
